  {panel}

h3. Summary
System avatar icons used for custom issue types causes the following symptoms when a notification is sent:
* Users will see broken image in email. 
* Administrator will see error in logs.
{noformat}
System Avatar not found at the following resource path: /avatars/medium_genericissue.png
{noformat}
See below for full stack-trace.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable email notification
# Create custom issue type 'tst', use any of system avatars.
# Create issue with custom issue type 'tst'
# Wait for notification to be sent
# Check logs and notification email

h3. Expected Results
No errors in logs when email is sent. User receives email without broken image. 

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file for every notification sent:

these system avatars have only one size: xsmall

h3. Workaround #1
Upload your own avatar and assign it to custom issue type. You can also re-upload same avatar from standard issue type if you want to have the same icon.

h3. Workaround #2
According to [this comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-43997?focusedCommentId=771008&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-771008], issue can be resolved by copying the {{xsmall}} files to {{medium}} ones. Thanks [~agslab]!

If you are on Linux, you can simply run the below script we've put together on the {{<JIRA_INSTALL>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/avatars}} directory (make sure you have read/write permission on the folder).
[^rename.sh]

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43992].
  {panel}

h3. Description
[System information|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Viewing+your+System+Information] is viewable by a JIRA administrator, however it has no simple way to export that information.

h3. Suggestion
Implement a export feature, allowing users to choose which System Info sections they would like to have information exported. Suggested export formats would be .pdf and .xls files.
fields.summary: Export system information on JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43987].
  {panel}

h4. Actual Behaviour
At the moment, there's no way to actually display the work logged within an issue in a certain date range using the existing time tracking functionality built into JIRA. 

h4. Requested Behaviour
The desired behaviour is to filter Issues to show only hours logged in a particular time period as it will allows user to generate accurate customer reports for a given time period using *JIRA Dashboards* which rely on Issue filters.

h4. Workaround
Export all data to Excel and manipulate the data there.
fields.summary: Filter Issues to show only hours logged in a particular time period

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43986].
  {panel}

A lot of open source projects that are using JIRA use the voting mechanism (as a popularity measure) as one of the guidance signals for feature prioritisation.
However in order to be able to vote a user needs to be loggend-in which prevents a lot of users to perform a vote - thats especially the case for users who just came by via a google search.

It would be helpful to have an additional measurement to approximate the popularity of a particular feature request or bug. One such measurement you be simple to expose the hit-count (e.g. how often was this particular issue requested) - this is be a simple measure that should be easy to collect which would improve the "popularity" signal for a particular issue.

It should be possible to see this the hit-count in detail- as well as list-view. It should also be exposed via the REST API.
fields.summary: Introduce issue hit-counter or make it available as field.
Remove Contact the Administrators if not enabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43981].
  {panel}

re: JRA-43836, this isn't the first time a JIRACloud update has killed webhooks.  For me specifically, this is a really bad outcome, as my cloud addon is dependent on them.  All my customers got an outage because of this, some may still not know there is a problem.  I don't know who has the problem because I can't guage status, which leads me to:

As a Cloud addon, I have no way to validate the 'heath' of the core Atlassian Connect infrastructure (of which webhooks are a part).  Some potential options:  

# Atlassian could implement some post instance startup validation to sanity check things like 'is webhooks enabled / usable' (specifically talking of JIRACloud here, so Atlassian can 'know' about the problem at boot time, rather than customer feedback time ;))
# Atlassian could create an Hourly Webhook 'Im alive' POST including a payload of internal healthheck status.  This allows addons to track when a host was last 'healthy', potentially communicating to host owner about that.  (possible, but Id rather not get auto pinged to death, if I got a webhook 5m ago, I dont need to know webhooks are healthy)
# Atlassian could add a new REST service to divulge internal health check would make all manner of 3rd party monitoring possible, Pingdom : "webhooks : enabled" etc.  I would find this very handy. (possibly valid for JIRAserver as well as JIRACloud, being able to locally in an addon, know I hadn't got a webhook for more than an hour, could start polling health to check status, taking notification action as necessary)
fields.summary: How to verify JIRACloud webhook functionality is working

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43977].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Our QA team loves attaching swf movies (from Jing) showing steps to reproduce a defect. However with JIRA it turns what should be a simple process into a multi-step pain.

h3. Suggested Solution
# Click attachment. Browser navigates to attachment directly and plays it in the same window

h3. Workaround
# Click attachment
# Jira sends attachment with mime-type application/octet-stream so that the browser will prompt to download it
# Chrome offers to "Keep" or "discard" it. Click "Keep"
# Find & drag attachment from its download location into a browser window
# After watching movie, go find useless swf and delete it
fields.summary: As a user, I want SWF attachments (from Jing) to play in the browser

  {panel}

JIRA Version 6.4.7

How to Reproduce.

1. In Evolution application (email client) save messages in it's native format.

2. Save filename with symbols, ':' , ';' etc.

3. Attach file to message, receive error message "File name cannot contain the character ':'"

4a. *(Expected)* Attach file to ticket, receive error message "Filename cannot contain the character ':'.

4b. *(Actual )* Attach file to ticket, receive error message "Internal Server Error occured"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43960].
  {panel}

h4. Description:
Shared filters page shows usernames of filter owners, even for not logged users. This is not desirable since an attacker can utilize the usernames for in a brute force or dictionary attack.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# As an unauthenticated user, run a search for any term.
# The results pages has a "Find Filters" link
# Clicking on the "Find Filters" link redirects to a page with an option for "Popular".
# Clicking "Popular" lists filters "Shared with all users" and the usernames of authors of those filters.

h4. Suggestion:
Hide the owner of the filter when an unauthenticated user tries to search for it. Alternatively, you can consider hiding only the username of the owner and show only its complete name.
fields.summary: Shared filters page display username of filter owners for public

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43931].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The JIRA login screen does not allow any customization to place company required messages.

Some companies require that disclaimers or company specific information are displayed on every login screen.

h3. Suggested Solution

Create an optional text area on the login screen which can be edited by Administrators to provide these required messages to their users.

h3. Workaround 
The following knowledge base article contains instructions how to customize the screen.  However this requires modifying plug-in code, which is not supported by Atlassian and requires the Administrator to have coding knowledge. 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Customise+the+Login+Gadget
fields.summary: As an Admin, I want to add custom text to the login screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43930].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When upgrading from one version of JIRA / Confluence Server to a newer, we can only see if plugins are compatible. Some of these plugins may no longer be free as well. Being able to see if a plugin was ever implemented / used would be helpful in determining which plugins / addons needed to be carried over into the new version.

h3. Environment
This would apply to Server versions of JIRA and Confluence only.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go through upgrade process
# Output list of all currently installed plugins / addons

h3. Expected Results
# Go through upgrade process
# Output list of all currently installed plugins / addons
# List indicates if there is a newer version available, is paid or free, has been used or not

h3. Actual Results
# Go through upgrade process
# Output list of all currently installed plugins / addons
# List indicates if there is a newer version available
fields.summary: Allow JIRA / Confluence Server to show which plugins / addons have and havent been used
Easier navigation between versions
Allow more broad project management through REST

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43921].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Outgoing JIRA email get stucked at mail queue if the user on Exchange has set to block JIRA email address. Hence, this situation creates load in mail queue and all the mail will be on the error mail queue as well. 

h3. Suggested Solution
The ability to specify somewhere in JIRA to exclude those user's email that has been set to block in Exchange.  

OR

To make JIRA to put those email with certain error (such as "User 'username' does not have permission") to placed in another queue to avoid in increasing in mail queue load.
fields.summary: To have ability to exclude user that has been blocked in Exchange

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43904].
  {panel}

Users accidentally lose their intended searches because they do the following:

1. User types in a JQL
2. User clicks "Save" before running the search
3. JIRA happily saves the search *before* the user typed in the new JQL.
4. The UI doesn't prompt the user that the JQL has since changed since the last run. <-- this is the main failure point.

This problem is a vector for other problems on large JIRA instances (JRA-35627) which causes users to create a filter for every issue in the instance. This can lead to crashes when users use this filter on a:

* JIRA Agile Scrum board: GHS-12171
* Or a Two-Dimensional filter against all issues on your system split by assignee/project.

Try the above two on any instance with a million issues and it'll crash the system.
fields.summary: Saving search filters UX discards a user's intended search
Improve the visibility of Add-on edit license button

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43888].
  {panel}

h4. +Steps to reproduce+
# Connect JIRA to an external user directory
# Create a project and set Project Lead to one of the external users
# *Disable the external user directory*, so that the Project Lead's user account is removed from JIRA
# Go to Projects dropdown menu -> View All Projects and perform a project search

h4. +Expected behavior+
Projects can be filtered using the keyword

h4. +Actual behaviors+
# The search function does not work and projects can't be filtered
# The project with the external Project Lead states that it has no Project Lead:
!projects.png|thumbnail!
# The browser URL is not appended with {{&contains=<keyword>}}
# The browser F12 Console shows this JS error:
!console.png|thumbnail!

h4. +Workaround+
# Find all the projects with the same problem from JIRA Administration -> Projects
# Go to their Administration Panel -> Roles -> update Project Lead to an Active User
!project_lead.png|thumbnail!

(i) If there're too many projects to update, the following SQL query can be used to search for them in the database:
{code}select * from project where lead not in (select lower_user_name from cwd_user);{code}
Then the following query can be used to update the Project Lead of these projects to a valid username:
{code}update project set lead = '<an_active_username_in_lowercase>' where lead not in (select lower_user_name from cwd_user);{code}
(!) the username must be in lowercase
(i) JIRA needs restarting (and maybe re-indexing) for the change to take effect

h4. +Notes+
# Project Search always fails under All Projects category, because it definitely contains one or more problematic projects
# Similarly, it fails under those Categories which contain one or more problematic projects
# For those Categories without a problematic project, Project Filter works, no matter how many pages there are
fields.summary: Project Search does not work if a Project has a Project Lead in a disabled directory

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43883].
  {panel}

"Follow Referrals" is on by default for the AD connector, but off by default for other connectors.

This option uses the node referral (JNDI lookup java.naming.referral) configuration setting. It is generally needed for Active Directory servers configured without proper DNS, to prevent a 'javax.naming.PartialResultException: Unprocessed Continuation Reference(s)' error.

However, with proper DNS it is often not required, and can cause multiple issues that can be difficult to diagnose.

Is it possible to turn it off by default, and/or have some more detailed explanation of when it is required in the docs/in product?

Examples issues this can cause:
* [Confluence PartialResultExceptions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/User+Lookups+Fail+With+%27PartialResultExceptions%27+Due+to+Active+Directory+%27Follow+Referrals%27+Configuration]
* [JIRA PartialResultExceptions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/User+Lookups+Fail+With+%27PartialResultExceptions%27+Due+to+Active+Directory+%27follow+referrals%27+Configuration]
fields.summary: Disable "Follow Referrals" in the AD Connector by default

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43881]. {panel} JIRA uses clipboard-unfriendly HTML and CSS to display the issue key and summary title on many pages (like the one you're reading right now). This makes it unnecessarily hard to copy and paste the key and summary into an email or other document (something I do 5+ times per day). JIRA could make small changes to its HTML markup and CSS that would not change how the page looks but would make it much easier to copy, paste, and share JIRA info with the outside world. In particular: * title and summary should show up as a single line of text in text-only clipboard clients * formatting should be easy to repair for rich-text clients after pasting To repro: * on this page, use the mouse to select both the issue key and summary * copy selection to clipboard * paste into the title of an Outlook email (or Google Docs or Word or ...) Expected: 1 line of text, because that's all that will fit into an Outlook email title. Ideally text that's a normal font size. And formatted like this: JIRA-1234 - Make it easier to copy key and summary. Actual: * In outlook email titles, only the issue key shows up. You'll need to paste the clipboard somewhere else, remove the newline, then paste into the email * In rich-text apps (Google docs, Word, etc.) you'll get a one-line list (which breaks any bullet points you paste into) and then a second paragraph of the summary in a huge font. * If you use Word's/Outlook's "Merge Formatting" feature to try to match the formatting to your document, you end up with the issue key being 1. in a numbered list because the key is inside an LI element in HTML. Possible Solution: By making a few minor HTML and CSS changes, and without making any changes to how your key + summary HTML is displayed, you could make a big improvement in how this content is pasted. Here's what I did in Firebug as a proof of concept: 1. changed the OL/LI elements currently used for the project name and key to SPAN elements with similar CSS. This is the first step to get plain-text clipboard clients (e.g. Outlook mail titles) to treat the selection as one line instead of two. This change also prevents problematic impact on bullet points and also enables Word/Outlook Merge Formatting to work correctly. 2. added a SPAN after the issue key with content of " - " and style="color:transparent". This adds a " - " after the issue key that won't be normally visible (it's transparent!) but will be copied to the clipboard. 3. wrapped the H1 issue summary title with a DIV with style="display: inline-block; width: 100%;". This is the second part of convincing clipboard clients that this is a one-line block of text. Steps 1-3 above enable a single line of plain text to be pasted. Whoo-hoo! But rich-text clipboard clients (e.g. Word, Google Docs) still display the text as two lines because the H1 is recognized as a line-breaking block element, even when wrapped inside that sneaky inline-block DIV. But, if you're willing to change the H1 element, then you can get all the text onto one line in all clients using step #4 below: 4. Change the H1 to a SPAN with similar CSS as the H1. I used this CSS: display: inline-block; font-size: 24px; margin-top: -2px; margin-bottom: -2px; This is still not perfect because the text is in a big font size, but it's massively better than the current state. Below is the Firebugged HTML after steps 1-4 above. I'm not suggesting you should implement exactly like this, but only want to illustrate that minor HTML and CSS changes could improve usability in an important part of the product without changing how the page looks. {{
Seed Web / AEON-10353 - Reports cannot be viewed in chrome on iPad
}}
fields.summary: Non-visible HTML/CSS tweaks could ease copying of issue key & summary to clipboard

We are facing problems about saving data during edit issue.

2. update issue

{{May 18, 2015 11:09:40 AM org.apache.coyote.http11.AbstractHttp11Processor process
INFO: Error parsing HTTP request header
 Note: further occurrences of HTTP header parsing errors will be logged at DEBUG level.}}

Workaround:
1. Copy the content from input textbox into notepad and clean the form.
2. Save the edit screen.
3. click edit issue
4. Copy content from notepad into input textbox of edit screen
5. Save, and it will be saved successfully.

And, this problem is not happening in IE browser.

  {panel}

h3. Summary
Inserting an image via toolbar's Insert Image throws error "Unable to render embedded object" 

h3. Environment
* Safari with Western Encoding
* JIRA

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use Safari, and ensure encoding is set to default Western ISO
# Attach an image on JIRA with a title including accented characters (e.g. é)
# Use the insert image option from your toolbar: !Screen Shot 2015-06-16 at 14.42.05.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
In Chrome and Firefox, attaching in this way does display the thumbnail.

h3. Actual Results
In Safari, you receive this error:
{noformat}
Unable to render embedded object: File (FILENAME) not found.
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
Change default encoding to UTF-8, or try in another browser, such as Firefox or Chrome.
fields.summary: Inserting attached image with accented characters unable to render

  {panel}

*Scenario*
- Setup new email handler with the option to "creates new issue or comment when email received".
-* Do not give the permission to create users.
- Send an email to the mail handler that contains users in CC section of email(the users *must* not be JIRA users).

*Actual Result:*
JIRA Creates issue but ignores the users that were in CC list as they are not JIRA users.

*Wanted Result*
JIRA would store these emails somewhere within the ticket created and send updates to them as with original CC expectation, without making these users JIRA users nor would they be added to the watcher list.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA Store CCs that are not JIRA Users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43844].
  {panel}

h3. ***Current Behavior***

When creating a new sub-task, the default status of the subtask would be based on the workflow of the associated issue type.


h3. ***Feature Request***

We would like to have the option to set all newly created sub-task to the status of the parent issue.


{panel:title=Original Request}
1.	What are the current issues that you face with the existing feature?
The current behaviour (as you have specified) using an OnDemand Jira instance, is limiting me from having separate boards for Planning and In Progress/Daily Standup work. My choices with the current implementation are

1. To have a single kanban board for all stories in our backlog as well as work currently in play (which has the significant negative effect of making our preferred Epic Based Swimlanes impractical, due to long lists of planned work that need to be scrolled through to get to the next Epic of work in Progress), or 
2. To keep flitting back-and-forth between Planning boards and In Progress boards to move sub-tasks through the planning statuses and into the In Progress statuses. 
The way that we run agile, we rarely create sub-tasks until our stories are taken into our In Progress statuses, as we tend not to do detailed analysis until the story is ready to play.

2.	What would you like to be able to do in the future?
Full description of the requested feature
I would like to have the option to specify the status that I want sub-tasks to be created in. Ideally I would like them to be created in the To Do Column of my In Progress board if the story is already represented in a status on that board, or, in the case of a story that is still in a status of my Planning board, to be created in the status of the parent story. I realise this is quite complex to implement, so I would be happy with a limited solution of having the option to just create the sub-tasks in the same status as the parent issue from which they are created (at least this way I could ensure they are on the same board as the parent issue)

3.	How would you like this feature to behave?
Any ideas you may have on how the desired feature should be implemented. (If any) 
I would propose having a Post Condition on the Create Transition in the Workflow that allowed me to specify that "if the issuetype is sub-task, then set status to that of the parent issue".
I realise that you are unable to guarantee this feature request will be implemented, or if so, offer an ETA on the work, but I wish to emphasise that this is really hindering all our teams on a daily basis. I am currently in the process of rolling out JIRA across my organisation, and whilst the teams I have already migrated are generally really pleased with the functionality offered by JIRA over their previous system, this is a constant source of frustration to them.
{panel}
fields.summary: Set the Default status of a Sub-Task based on the Parent Issue Status

Scenario:

A public Jira is setup for joint venture purposes. The configured roles are 
Administrator (projadmins)
Internal (internal users)
External (external company users)

Using the comment security feature an external user can hide comments from other users within the issue/Jira in a project that belongs to internal users/projleads/projadmins.

The permission I suggest is missing is the "View all comments" which should be set to the Administrator/Internal role.

Or: It should be possible to limit the comment security feature to specific roles.
fields.summary: Missing permission in permission scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43839].
  {panel}

As a JIRA administrator I want to configure heap and/or CPU limits for users or threads so that user activity can't take down JIRA.

h3. Problem Definition

Users can either accidentally or intentionally generate a huge result as the result of a search and this can make JIRA unresponsive to the point of requiring a restart.  Enterprise instances are more vulnerable because they have so many more records and concurrent users.

h3. Suggested Solution

* An admin screen where per-user or per-thread limits on heap and CPU consumption can be defined.
* When these limits are reached the thread in question should be killed or throw an exception.
* As a fallback alternative, it would be useful to a view of which threads are consuming large amounts of heap/CPU and which username is associated with them.

h3. Workaround

None... instances of any size can be taken down by a Lucene query with a sufficiently large result set to chew up all the heap.
fields.summary: Ability to limit heap and CPU consumption to prevent performance crashes

Hi,

while the image selection plugin is a very nice addition, I would argue that most of the uploaded project icons don't need significant cropping.

If you currently upload an icon, the selection helper is quite small somewhere in the image:

!Screen Shot 2015-06-15 at 13.25.07.png|thumbnail!

I think it would be better if the selection area would "fit" in the selection, but stretching to touch at least two borders (like the CSS property {{background-size: contain;}} works):

For portrait images (“select full width and center vertically”):
!portrait.png|thumbnail!

For landscape images (“select full height and center horizontally”):
!landscape.png|thumbnail!

For square images (“select all”):
!square.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Maximize selection area when uploading a project image

*Problem:*
When multiple mail handlers point to the same Mail Server, there is a race condition causing the handlers to miss emails as shown at: [JRA-42044|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-42044]

*Suggestion:*
Since the race condition was closed as "Won't Fix", please create a restriction from the UI to prevent the creation of Mail Handlers on Mail Servers that already have a Mail Handler configured to it.

*Scenario:*
Administrators sometimes configure different Mail Handlers to one Mail Server and using the Catch Email functionality they split incoming emails into multiple projects.
fields.summary: Restrict Incoming Mail Handlers association to used Mail Servers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43824].
  {panel}

Every single time I make an administrative  change now I get a pop-up notification covering up options I want to click that tells me something I know and find very annoying to be reminded about EVERY SINGLE TIME I make an administrative change.

I click the X on the notification and it pops right back up again when the page refreshes. I go and do what it says (re-index) and the instant I modify anything else it's popping the fuck back up again coving up something I want to read or interact with on the form.

Is there some option somewhere that I can modify to turn this feature off? Or, failing that, Is there a module somewhere I can disable to removing these annoyance level 11 notification pummelling?

I'm just positive there's more issues like this and this one'll be closed as a duplicate shortly after I create it but I really wanted to bitch about it for a while and get some friends to vote as well.

In the attached screenshots notice how I'm editing a field configuration not being used by any project changing the config to 'show' the environment field.

Screenshot #4 shows the notification blob that now is covering up two very useful buttons on the form.

Thanks,
-wc

William Crighton

/edit/
to me the easiest would be to just provide another dark feature type option that just disabled the notifications all together. They do provide value, however, so another approach would be to have a 'server notifications' page, much like the audit page, and people could subscribe to it.
fields.summary: Administrative notices are incredibly annoying - please provide option to disable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43823].
  {panel}

h3. Summary


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Hide Resolution field
#* Access JIRA
#* Click on the cogwheel icon
#* Click on Issues
#* Click on Field Configurations
#* Click on Configure, next to the scheme your project is using
#* Search for Resolution field, click on Hide located next to it
# Add the gadget Issue Statistics to your dashboard
#* Open your dashboard
#* Click on Add Gadgets
#* Search for "Issue Statistics"
#* Click on Add gadget button next to Issue Statistics
#* On the gadget, select a filter of the project which the scheme was configure on the step one
#* Click on Save

h3. Expected Results
The gadget should list the issue types of returned by the filter, the number and percentage of issues under those issue types

h3. Actual Results
No Data Available


h3. Notes
-

h3.Workaround
# Click on the cogwheel icon
# Click on Issues
# Click on Field Configurations
# Click on Configure, next to the scheme your project is using
# Search for Resolution field, click on Show located next to it
fields.summary: Issue Statistics gadget returns "No Data Available" if the field Resolution is hidden

h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, when users are created using project import, their last login information is not imported in the new instance.
Steps to reproduce : 
* Use project import to import data from another instance.
* Notice that it adds new users that are not already present on the instance.
* However it does not include the last login information for the users. 
* The last login information is shown as "not recorded".

h3. Suggested Solution
We would be able to import the last login information from the source instance. If not, there should be an option to set it to the import date.

At the moment, users with the *Manage Group Filter Subscriptions* global permission are able to select any groups to be recipients of a filter subscription (source:https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Receiving+Search+Results+via+Email). It would be better if we can manage which groups shows up in the list in the first place.

Use Case:
# The default *jira-users* group shows up in the list. Users might accidentally select this group which will "spam" *all* users with this filter subscription. Hiding this group will avoid such situation.
# There might be certain groups meant for particular things which will not require to receive filter subscriptions at all so we should be able to just hide it from showing up in the first place
fields.summary: Hide groups from Filter Subscription
